shortlist.name: Khafiz (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 6.4 exchange (solid market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winning form (two wins from last four starts) and represents a top trainer-jockey combination. The horse has shown ability to win at this level and is not exposed, with only one poor run in latest. Connections are in strong form and odds offer value for a runner with proven winning profile.

shortlist.name: Northern Express (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 7.4 exchange (well-backed, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this class, often running well in competitive handicaps. Recent form includes several close finishes and the horse is proven over course and distance. Trainer and jockey have a good record at Ayr, and odds reflect realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Almeric
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 5/4 (SBK), 2.48 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break to win latest start, suggesting improvement and readiness. Top jockey and trainer combination. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and recent winning form.

shortlist.name: King's Gambit (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice at 4/1 (SBK), 4.8 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, regularly placing. Solid connections and competitive odds. While not a prolific winner, reliability and experience make him a logical contender if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Nariko (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 6.6 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with four consecutive wins, including this season; top jockey booked; trainer in form; odds reflect strong market support and realistic chance. No sign of regression in recent form and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Binhareer (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 6.4 exchange (solid second-fav, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with recent placed efforts in competitive company; trainer excels with this type; form figures show reliability and ability to handle similar races. Odds offer fair value for a horse with proven consistency and strong connections.

shortlist.name: Coming Attraction (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 5.3 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins and a second from last three starts, representing a top stable in strong current form. Odds reflect solid market support and suggest strong confidence. No sign of regression and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Dandana
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.7 exchange (well-supported, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with two wins and a fourth in last three, partnered by a top jockey. Stable is reliable at this level. Recent form is competitive and odds indicate respect from the market.

shortlist.name: Lightning Polka
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 6.6 exchange (market respect, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Impressive debut winner, open to significant improvement for a trainer adept with progressive types. Market support is notable for a lightly raced runner. No evidence of needing major improvement beyond natural progression.

shortlist.name: Northern Ticker (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 9.8 exchange (solid, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed form indicates peak condition; trainer and jockey have strong Ayr records. Consistent performer at this level, with latest win suggesting readiness for another big run.

shortlist.name: Red Spells Danger (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.4 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a 3rd and 6th in two starts, suggesting reliability and experience. Tim Easterby is a respected trainer and David Allan is a capable jockey. The horse is well found in the market, indicating strong confidence from connections and punters. No signs of needing major improvement to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Nobody Knows (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.95 exchange (well-backed debutant, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Debutant with top connections: Oisin Murphy is a leading jockey and Richard Hughes is a trainer with a good record with juveniles. Market support is strong, suggesting positive reports from the yard. While unraced, the lack of exposed form is offset by the confidence in the betting and the quality of connections.

shortlist.name: Kelpie Grey
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 (SBK), 4.6 (exchange) – prominent in market, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form at this level, regularly placing and running well in competitive handicaps. Local trainer-jockey combination is in good order. Odds reflect solid market support and suggest strong chance without being overbet.
shortlist.confidence: High – reliable profile, strong connections, and market support.

shortlist.name: Jannas Journey (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 (SBK), 5.8 (exchange) – well-fancied, not a longshot
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with six wins from last seven starts, showing clear progression and adaptability. Trainer in form and booking of David Egan is a positive. Odds offer fair value for a prolific winner stepping up in class.
shortlist.confidence: High – exceptional winning sequence, proven attitude, and strong connections.

shortlist.name: Sheikh Raj (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 (SBK), 6.4 (exchange) – solidly in the market
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with recent runner-up finish, and top jockey Oisin Murphy booked. Trainer is adept at placing horses to win at this level. Form suggests ready to strike and odds are competitive.
shortlist.confidence: Medium-High – upward trajectory, top connections, and market respect.

shortlist.name: Highfield Viking
shortlist.odds_note: 7/1 (SBK), 6.4 (exchange) – not an outsider, respected in market
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent, with two recent wins and placed efforts. Remains in good heart and connections are reliable. Odds are fair for a horse with strong recent form and proven competitiveness.
shortlist.confidence: Medium – consistent performer, solid value, and reliable connections.

shortlist.name: Look Back Smiling (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.0 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive handicaps, regularly finishing in the frame. Market support is strong, indicating confidence. Connections are in good order and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Silent Move
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 9.4 exchange (well-supported, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a solid recent second, suggesting readiness to win. Trained by a respected yard and has shown ability at this grade. Odds reflect genuine market interest.

shortlist.name: Havana Prince
shortlist.odds_note: 8/1 SBK, 6.2 exchange (shorter on exchange, indicating support)
shortlist.rationale: Has won and placed multiple times this season, showing reliability and competitiveness. Exchange odds are notably shorter than fixed-odds, suggesting smart money. Connections capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Dubai Time
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.8 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and a third in last three starts, indicating peak condition. Trained by Hugo Palmer, who is reliable at Chester, and partnered by experienced jockey Luke Morris. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest a leading chance.

shortlist.name: Go Victor (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.1 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and a close second, showing clear competitiveness at this level. Market position as second favourite is justified by consistent performances and ability to handle similar company. Connections are in good form and the horse is holding condition.

shortlist.name: Callahan
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 11/10 (SBK), 2.32 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Solid debut third in a likely warm maiden, now faces a field lacking proven winners. Top jockey booking and clear market support indicate strong connections and expectation. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Fizzy Cristal
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market; 15/4 (SBK), 5.2 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Improved from debut sixth to a close third last time, showing progression. Trained by a respected local handler and drawn well for Chester. Form is competitive for this grade and odds offer some value against the favourite.

shortlist.name: Yorkshire Queen
shortlist.odds_note: Third in market; 9/2 (SBK), 5.6 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent filly with second and fourth in two starts, suggesting reliability. Trainer in good form and runner has experience, which is valuable at Chester. Should be in the mix if reproducing best effort.

shortlist.name: Al Shabab Storm
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite, 4/6 (SBK), 1.96 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive at this level, with recent form showing multiple placings and a win last season. Connections are respected, and current odds reflect strong market support. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Paws For Thought (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.35 exchange (clear market leader)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placed efforts at this level, and now faces a slightly easier field. Proven at Chester and well drawn for a prominent run. Connections are in good form and the odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Count D'orsay (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 4.6 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Has been running consistently in competitive sprints and is well handicapped on old form. Recent efforts suggest a return to form is possible, and the stable has a good record with sprinters at Chester. Market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Jer Batt (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.9, SBK 85/40 (clear market leader, strong support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with three consecutive third-place finishes, indicating reliability and current form. Connections are respected, and the horse is well found in the market, suggesting confidence from punters and professionals. No sign of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Balon D'or
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 7, SBK 10/3 (solid second-favorite, holding value)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner (last time out), showing ability to get the job done. Trainer is in good form and the horse is not overexposed at this level. Odds reflect strong market respect and recent improvement.

shortlist.name: Smart Vision
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 5.6, SBK 11/2 (well-backed, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here off a win, indicating peak form. Has shown versatility and resilience in recent starts. Market support is notable and connections are capable at this level.

shortlist.name: No More Bolero
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support (5/2 SBK, 4.1 exchange), clear favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up finish signals return to form and readiness. Luke Morris is a reliable jockey, and the horse’s odds reflect strong confidence from both bookmakers and exchange markets. Connections are in good order and the horse has shown ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Solar Pass
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market (3/1 SBK, 4.9 exchange), consistent performer.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win this season. Andrew Balding is a respected trainer, and the horse’s odds indicate solid support. Has shown ability to handle competitive fields and is likely to be in the mix.

shortlist.name: Dino Bellagio
shortlist.odds_note: Solid each-way chance (7/2 SBK, 6 exchange), not far behind market leaders.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive with a win and placed efforts. Donald McCain is a capable trainer, and the horse’s odds suggest genuine respect from the market. Has shown improvement and consistency, making him a credible contender.

shortlist.name: Jupiter Ammon (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support (5/2 SBK, 3.5 exchange), clear favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a reliable trainer-jockey combination. Has shown ability to handle competitive fields and is holding form well, suggesting readiness to win at this level. Odds reflect strong market confidence and value for a likely winner.

shortlist.name: Baikal (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid second choice (15/4 SBK, 4.6 exchange), not far behind favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent win and consistent improvement. Trainer is adept at placing horses to win in handicaps, and jockey is experienced. Form suggests Baikal is peaking at the right time and offers value just behind the favourite.

shortlist.name: Asteverdi
shortlist.odds_note: Competitive odds (10/3 SBK, 5.1 exchange), third in market.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and solid placings, indicating reliability and fitness. Trainer has a good record at Chester and the horse has shown adaptability. Not as strong as the top two but rates a solid chance based on form and connections.

shortlist.name: Rumstar
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.7 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Rumstar is the most consistent performer in the field, with multiple wins and recent solid efforts at this level. The horse is fit, in-form, and proven at the track and trip. Connections are reliable, and the odds reflect strong market support. No major improvement is needed for a repeat win.

shortlist.name: Montassib
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.9 exchange (well-supported, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Montassib is trained by William Haggas, a top yard, and has a profile of winning fresh. The form shows a string of wins and a layoff, but the horse has previously run well off breaks. Market support is solid, and the class/ability is proven. No major improvement required, just needs to run to previous best.

shortlist.name: Rage Of Bamby (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 6.8 exchange (third choice in market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Rage Of Bamby has been running consistently in competitive races and has recent placed efforts. The horse is fit, in-form, and connections are capable. Odds are fair for a horse with proven ability at this level. No major improvement needed, just needs to hold current form.

shortlist.name: Majestic Warrior (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.6 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced, progressive profile with two wins from last four starts and a recent win after a layoff. Jockey Hector Crouch is in strong recent form, and the horse has proven ability at this level. No signs of regression and connections are reliable.

shortlist.name: Dramatic Star
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 7.6 exchange (well-supported, not a longshot)

shortlist.name: Beylerbeyi
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 7.6 exchange (within main market group)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with three wins and a second from last five starts. Recent form is strong, and the horse is proven at the trip. Jamie Spencer is a capable jockey for this type of race. No major negatives on current evidence.

shortlist.name: Defiance (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.5 Exchange (market leader)

shortlist.name: Night Step
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 6.2 Exchange (second choice)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is excellent, with two wins and two seconds from last four starts, indicating peak condition. Trainer Burrows is adept with improving types, and odds are fair for a horse with this consistency.

shortlist.name: Theory Of Tides
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 6.4 Exchange (third in market)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced this season but shaped well on reappearance after a break. Gosden team excels with horses second-up, and Tudhope is a positive booking. Odds offer value if returning to best form.

shortlist.name: Into The Sky (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 3.25 exchange (market leader)

shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.6 exchange (well-supported, second favorite)

shortlist.name: Rock On Thunder (Ire)

shortlist.name: Sticktoyourguns
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 2.66 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)

shortlist.name: Linwood (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.9 exchange (solid favourite, not an outsider)

shortlist.name: Akkadian Thunder
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 4.4 exchange (market leader, not an outsider)

shortlist.name: Herculeus
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.6 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form, winning last time out and showing steady progression this season. Connections are reliable and the horse has proven ability at this level. Odds reflect strong market confidence and he does not require major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Stem (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 5.3 exchange (well respected in the market)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with scope for further progress, placed in a competitive race last time and has already won at this level. Top connections and a profile suggesting more to come. Odds are fair for a horse with this profile.

shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 2.88 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Represents the powerful Appleby yard with a top jockey booked. Market leader in a race lacking exposed form, suggesting strong confidence from connections. No negatives on profile and stable excels with similar types.

shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 5.7 exchange (solid second favourite, holding in market)
shortlist.rationale: From the Gosden team, who are highly effective with debutants and unexposed types at this venue. Jockey is stable's go-to for promising sorts. Market position suggests strong expectations despite lack of public form.

shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.5 exchange (well-supported, clear third in market)

shortlist.name: Alfareqa
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.0 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)

shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 4.2 exchange (well-fancied, not an outsider)

shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 6.4 exchange (well-supported, not a longshot)

shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 6.6 exchange (within main market group)

shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 11/10 (SBK), 2.2 (exchange)

shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 11/2 (SBK), 7 (exchange)

shortlist.name: Noisy Music (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 4.8 exchange (clear market leader)

shortlist.name: Hilltop

shortlist.name: Latin (Ire)

shortlist.name: Youarenotforgiven

shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 (SBK), 5.1 (exchange) – prominent in the market, not an outsider

shortlist.name: Magnitude (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid market position, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Steven Asmussen is a prolific trainer with a proven record at Parx and similar circuits. Ben Curtis is a capable jockey with good tactical awareness. The combination of strong connections and market respect makes this runner a leading contender.

shortlist.name: Gosger (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Luis Saez is a top-tier jockey, and Brendan Walsh is a trainer with a consistent strike rate in competitive races. Horses from this partnership often show up well in the market and deliver strong performances. Early odds indicate genuine support.

shortlist.name: Banyan (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.odds_note: Clear favourite at 1.81 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut, indicating strong ability and potential for further improvement. Top jockey booking and leading stable. Market support is significant, suggesting confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: Roaming Spirit (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice at 2.62 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with recent win and placed efforts. Trained by a top yard and partnered by a capable jockey. Proven reliability at this level and trip.

shortlist.name: Juniper Green (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Third in market at 2.92 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Regularly in the frame and arrives off a win, showing current form. Connections are respected locally. Odds reflect genuine competitiveness in this field.

shortlist.name: Twentytwentyvision (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.81, joint market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows marked improvement with a win and a second in last two starts, indicating peak condition. Jockey Matsunyane is reliable and the trainer is respected locally. The odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse has proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Gimmethegoodlife (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.81, joint market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and a second in last three starts, suggesting the horse is holding top form. Trainer Peter is in good standing and the jockey has delivered on this horse before. Odds indicate strong support and the horse is proven at the course.

shortlist.name: Karate Kid (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 2.62, clear third choice.
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with three consecutive placings, showing reliability and competitiveness at this level. Trainer Matchett is capable and the horse has shown adaptability. Odds offer reasonable value for a runner consistently in the mix.

shortlist.name: Night Bomber (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 3.15, fourth in market.
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent with multiple placings and a win in last six starts, indicating the horse is genuine and competitive. Trainer Dawson is respected and the jockey has a solid strike rate. Odds are fair for a runner with strong place claims and potential to win if leaders underperform.

shortlist.name: Luce Verde (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.24 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with a win last time out and consistent performances in the current campaign. Top connections and the market's overwhelming support suggest reliability and readiness. No signs of regression in form.

shortlist.name: Mo Ment (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second favorite at 1.64 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Multiple recent wins and places indicate a horse in peak condition. Consistent finishing positions and competitive odds reflect strong market confidence. Connections are in good form.

shortlist.name: Vesuvio (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-supported at 1.75 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and several placings, showing competitiveness at this level. Odds suggest market respect and the horse is holding form well.

shortlist.name: Gimmeachoice (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear favourite at 1.47 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Comes in off a win (last run '1'), showing peak recent form and consistency. Top connections with Zackey/Soma, and the market strongly supports chances. No sign of decline in form cycle.

shortlist.name: Robert Browning (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice at 2.92 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and competitive odds suggest he is the main danger to the favourite. Trainer/jockey combination is reliable, and form shows ability to bounce back after moderate runs.

shortlist.name: King's Express (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear favourite at 1.45 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Has multiple recent wins and consistent form at this level, including two wins in last five starts. Connections are strong and current odds reflect clear market confidence. No evidence of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Soldier's Eye (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice at 2.62 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a win and several placings in recent starts. Form suggests reliability and ability to compete at this level. Odds are fair for a horse with proven competitiveness.

shortlist.name: Hemisphere (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.24 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and places, trained by a leading yard, and commands strong market support. No signs of regression in latest runs and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Bjorn Ironside (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.odds_note: Second favorite at 1.43 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Solid and reliable form profile, regularly in the frame, and from the same top stable as the favorite. Recent runs suggest fitness and competitiveness at this grade.

shortlist.name: Mystical Miss (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Third in the market at 1.64 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win on debut, suggesting potential upside. Connections are strong and the market support is notable, indicating stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Pennsylvania (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Fourth in the market at 2.12 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent form in the current campaign. Trainer is respected and the horse is holding form well, making it a legitimate contender.

shortlist.name: Paul Revere (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.62, joint-favorite
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and a second in last two starts, indicating peak fitness. Short odds reflect strong market confidence. Connections are reliable and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Max The Magician (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.62, joint-favorite
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent placings and a strong second last time out. Top jockey booking and competitive odds suggest stable confidence. Has been running consistently in similar company.

shortlist.name: Master Christmas (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.72, close to market leaders
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning ways last start, indicating improvement and readiness. Odds are competitive, and recent form spike suggests potential to follow up.

shortlist.name: Parisian Walkway (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 2.06 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Strong early-season form with a win and a close fifth, followed by two fair efforts in higher grade. Reliable connections and current odds reflect strong market confidence. No major signs of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Cocomelon (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second favorite at 2.92 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings this season, including a recent third. Trained by a top yard and holding form well. Odds are fair for a horse with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Count Huhtikuu (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-supported at 3.15 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and several competitive runs in similar company. Connections are in form and the horse has shown ability to handle the class. Odds suggest genuine market respect.

shortlist.name: Pumpkin Pie (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Joint third favorite at 3.15 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins from last five starts and a respectable fifth last time. Remains unexposed and could improve further. Odds are competitive for a lightly raced improver.
